snippet: As part of a national rush to capitalize on rising rents, new apartment complexes are being built at the fastest pace since 2008.
abstract: Developers in Houston, as in many other parts of the country, are building thousands of apartments as part of a national rush to capitalize on rising rents; residential building is recovering from a near standstill after the housing crisis and new apartment complexes are being built at fastest pace since 2008.

byline.original: By SHAILA DEWAN and NELSON D. SCHWARTZ
byline.contributor: Daniel Cadis contributed reporting from Houston.

lead_paragraph: As part of a national rush to capitalize on rising rents, new apartment complexes are being built at the fastest pace since 2008.

headline.seo: Developers of New Housing Aim for Renters, Not Buyers
headline.main: Soaring Rents Drive a Boom in Apartments
headline.print_headline: Soaring Rents Drive a Boom In Apartments
